headline: OpenAI details layered protections in US defense department pact
summary: OpenAI said on Saturday that the agreement it struck a day ago with the Pentagon to deploy technology on the ‌U.S. defense department's classified network includes additional safeguards to protect its use ‌cases.  U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday directed the government to stop working with Anthropic, and the Pentagon ​said it would declare the startup a supply-chain risk, dealing a major blow to the artificial intelligence lab after a showdown about technology guardrails.  Anthropic said it would challenge any risk designation in court.

Anthropic said it would challenge any risk designation in court.

headline: OpenAI just raised $110 billion and it still may not be enough
summary: OpenAI just broke its own record. headline: Microsoft Expands Starlink Alliance To Grow Azure And AI In Kenya
summary: Microsoft (NasdaqGS:MSFT) expanded its partnership with SpaceX's Starlink to bring satellite internet to hundreds of community hubs in Kenya. The collaboration aims to connect rural and remote areas to Azure cloud and AI services using Starlink's low Earth orbit satellite network. The move reflects a focus on underserved markets and comes despite legal frictions involving OpenAI and Elon Musk. For Microsoft, this Kenya rollout fits directly into its core cloud and AI business, widening the...

headline: OpenAI gives Pentagon AI model access after Anthropic dustup
summary: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said late Friday that he’d reached an agreement with the department that reflects the firm’s principles on prohibiting “domestic mass surveillance and human responsibility for the use of force, including for autonomous weapon systems.”  The startup also built safeguards to ensure its models behave as they should as part of the deployment, Altman said in a post on the social media platform X.

raw.headline: OpenAI gives Pentagon AI model access after Anthropic dustup
raw.summary: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said late Friday that he’d reached an agreement with the department that reflects the firm’s principles on prohibiting “domestic mass surveillance and human responsibility for the use of force, including for autonomous weapon systems.”  The startup also built safeguards to ensure its models behave as they should as part of the deployment, Altman said in a post on the social media platform X.

headline: Constellation Energy Expansion Links Calpine Deal And Data Center Growth
summary: Constellation Energy (NasdaqGS:CEG) completed its acquisition of Calpine Corporation, creating one of the largest electricity producers in the United States. The company expanded its power agreements with data center operators, including CyrusOne and Microsoft, targeting high-demand digital infrastructure. Constellation secured a Department of Energy loan guarantee to restart the Crane Clean Energy Center. Regulators approved 20 year license renewals for several core nuclear plants,...

headline: AI “factor flip”: Why Wall Street is dumping tech quality for traditional value
summary: The quantitative strategies that have governed trillions of dollars in global capital are facing a historic identity crisis. As artificial intelligence reshapes the economic landscape, long-held definitions of "safe" and "expensive" stocks are being turned upside down.
